snippet: Executives in the electronics industry often say that popular devices can’t be made in the United States largely because it would be too costly and inefficient. But in another industry, foreign auto companies have grown over the last 30 years to...
lead_paragraph: Executives in the electronics industry often say that popular devices can’t be made in the United States largely because it would be too costly and inefficient. But in another industry, foreign auto companies have grown over the last 30 years to account for over 40 percent of vehicles built here.

headline.main: Evolution of a Manufacturing Supply Chain
